summary.text:
**Considering citation inclusion**

It seems there was a question about including citations in the JSON schema for summarizer outputs. The earlier instructions had specified needing citations but the schema omitted them. I think we could potentially include citations within the `summary_md` or the `one_line_summary`. Maybe I could format them as a final line in `summary_md`, like "Citations: papers/paper1.txt, proofs.md, output.md." It’s important to ensure that `summary_md` stays concise, ideally around 120 words.

**Summarizing key concepts**

I need to include the main takeaways like DAGs characterizing graphs, the SCC composition method, and various UPA classes. Also, I should touch on cohesive-core conditions and obstructions like matching pennies and negative cycles, as well as mention the pipeline algorithm and new modules added. I’ll aim to write concise highlights and next questions while preparing a structured JSON output. The citations should be included as per the requirements, and I want to make sure everything is well-escaped in the JSON format.

content.text: {"summary_md":"This round establishes graph-level and modular guarantees for pure Nash equilibria (PNE) in binary signed-network coordination (SNC) games. Key results: a dependency digraph guarantees a PNE for every choice of W (zero-diagonal supported on that digraph) and h iff the digraph is acyclic (DAG) — sufficiency by backward induction, necessity via negative-product cycles that force inconsistent BR constraints. More generally, SCC composition: if every SCC is universally PNE-admitting (UPA) under arbitrary external fields (examples: undirected SCCs, structurally balanced SCCs after a gauge, functional-cycle SCCs with positive sign product), then solve SCCs from sinks upward to construct a global PNE and BR-path. Added diagnostics and constructive criteria: two-node digon test (same-sign arcs), functional-digraph cycle-sign test, cohesive-core inequalities and weight-dominance, dominant-negative-cycle obstruction. Draft algorithmic pipeline and extra modules (multi-core cohesive existence, bounded-length monotone BR paths, forest corollary) were provided. Citations: papers/paper1.txt; proofs.md; output.md","one_line_summary":"DAGs ⇔ uniform PNE guarantee; SCC/gauge composition and new UPA tests.","highlights":["Uniform characterization: a dependency digraph guarantees a PNE for all W,h iff it is a DAG (backward induction ⇔ no directed cycles).","SCC composition: if every SCC is universally PNE-admitting (e.g., undirected or structurally balanced after a gauge) then a global PNE exists; BR-path is constructed by solving SCCs from sinks upward.","New UPA tests: 2-node SCC UPA ⇔ W12·W21≥0 (forbids matching-pennies); functional digraphs (outdegree ≤1) UPA ⇔ every directed cycle has positive sign product.","Constructive sufficient conditions: cohesive-core bounds w_R+τ·h ≥ w_S (gauge variant) yield consensus/polarized PNE; |h_i|>∑_j|W_ij| guarantees a strict PNE.","Diagnostics/obstructions: matching-pennies digons and negative-sign directed cycles (especially dominant-negative cycles) certify nonexistence of PNE.","Algorithmic pipeline (draft): DAG check → SCC-decompose → per-SCC gauge/symmetry/functional tests → assemble PNE or apply cohesive-core checks / report obstructions."],"next_questions":["Characterize UPA SCCs beyond undirected/structurally-balanced/functional classes (complete structural/cycle criterion).","Implement a polynomial-time checker + PNE-constructor following the SCC/gauge/cohesive pipeline and test on benchmarks.","Assess tightness/necessity of cohesive-core and indecomposability bounds; produce minimal counterexamples when they fail."]}

one_line_summary.description: Brief one-line summary for UI display
one_line_summary.title: One Line Summary
